page.title: 08Wigtwizzle Plantation
page.content: Wigtwizzle Plantation is owned by Sheffield Metropolitan District Estate Surveyors Department.It lies to the south of Broomhead Reservoir on gently sloping land.The trees were planted about 40 years ago. They are mostly coniferous trees - larch, spruce and scots pine.A forest trail of approximately 3 km.can be followed. The trail takes you through the nursery area and into the mature woodland.In the older part of the plantation it is very dark and spooky and the grass is springy.The edge of the plantation had sycamore,rowan, beech and oak trees.A few plants grew where there was light - bramble, foxglove, bracken, gorse, bluebell, nettle, greater stitchwort, wood sorrel and herb robert.
